group_1.textLeft: When you suddenly leaped out like that,@I honestly thought my heart was going to stop.
What would you do if you had been stabbed in@a vital area?
It's lucky that you only needed a few stitches on@your shoulder.

group_1.textRight: Seriously... It feels like we've had this conversation@three times already...

group_1.textLeft: Rabi keeps bringing it up again...
I truly appreciate your concern for Magical Girls,
but I wish you wouldn't recklessly throw away@your life like that.

group_1.textRight: Yeah, I'll reflect on this...

group_1.textLeft: ...Your daughter is also a Magical Girl, right?
Your daughter, who you've been working so hard@for, would be the one to grieve if you died.

group_1.textRight: You're right...

group_1.textLeft: Rabi mentioned some details about what happened.
I don't mean to be rude, but may I ask?

group_1.textRight: What is it?

group_1.textLeft: Why are you so fixated on what's happening in@Yukuni City?
I'm curious about that as well.
Your insistence on having people understand@Magical Girls properly
isn't going to lead us to an escape from@becoming Witches.

group_1.textRight: Yeah, you're right.@It won't provide a fundamental solution.

group_1.textLeft: Then, why...?

group_1.textRight: Even so, I believe it can help reduce the number@of girls becoming Magical Girls.
Understanding the fate of Magical Girls could@reduce the number of children making contracts.
If we knew the wishes that girls who become@Magical Girls had fulfilled,
we would realize that we play a part in creating@their environment and suffering.

group_1.textLeft: So, essentially...

group_1.textRight: If people become kinder to each other, the reasons@for anyone to become a Magical Girl will decrease.
Besides, I believed that people would become@more tolerant of Magical Girls.

group_1.textLeft: ...If it isn't known, it does not exist.
There is a feeling that comes from being known...
My desire for sympathy and your views@might align, Professor.

group_1.textRight: Yes, perhaps they are in alignment.
Furthermore, if people could empathize with@Magical Girls, it might also serve as an opportunity
to raise awareness about the issues that@Magical Girls face in the world.
If everyone starts moving towards a solution,@our allies will multiply rapidly.
Considering the possibility of widespread research@into methods for avoiding Witch transformations,
bringing recognition to the existence of@Magical Girls holds great significance.

group_1.textLeft: For a Professor with views like yours, my situation@couldn't be overlooked...?

group_1.textRight: I've traveled all over the world, not just Japan,
but here, in Yukuni City,
was the first time I witnessed an effort to spread@the word about Magical Girls' existences.
And you, Rabi, the daughter of the innkeeper,@were at the center of it all.
I really wanted to help you, and I didn't want@you to fail...

group_1.textLeft: Is our movement really such an unusual one?

group_1.textRight: Despite the supposed existence of Magical Girls@since ancient times,
the evidence lies in the fact that they haven't@been mentioned throughout millennia of history.

group_1.textLeft: Does this mean that all attempts to raise@awareness about Magical Girls have failed?

group_1.textRight: Is it merely a matter of failure?
Or does even success lead to loss?@I do not know.
Still, in any case...

group_1.narration: "As I searched the world for answers,@I examined books and items related to individuals@who appeared to have been Magical Girls."
"Crucial aspects, like battles against Witches and@the fate of Magical Girls, were often omitted@and lost within the narratives of myths and legends."
"Even though there are instances in history@where people involved with Magical Girls and Witches@were massacred, the term 'Magical Girl' never@seems to be preserved..."

"As I observe these outcomes,@I can't help but feel that efforts to promote Magical Girls@are always mysteriously twisted by a force that feels almost@like divine mischief, regardless of the outcome."

group_1.textLeft: Twisted...by divine mischief...

group_1.textRight: Incidents and accidents involving Magical Girls@and Witches are unnaturally inconspicuous.
I believe this information hits close to home for@all of you.

group_1.textLeft: If it seems as though we're being manipulated@by some external force,
then nothing we do will make any difference...
Even you, Professor, are striving to dispel that@sense of resignation,
fighting to keep hope alive and not giving up...

group_1.textRight: Yes, I'm inspiring my own heart not to give up, too.
It's a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to rewrite@the history of Magical Girls, after all.
So, please let me lend a hand, for the sake of@everyone's happiness.

group_1.textLeft: We were on the brink of giving up on being@recognized, but now...

group_1.textRight: Let's rise once more.

group_1.textLeft: Let's recall our original purpose and stick with it@one last time.
However, in order to restore trust in Magical Girls,
it is necessary to overcome a significant wall.

group_1.textRight: A wall, you say?

group_1.textLeft: We need to get people to accept the truth―
The reality that we become Witches.
